intro: Lloydia nana, commonly known as the dwarf lloydia, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves that are typically covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink or white, which bloom in late spring or early summer. Lloydia nana is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in well-drained, sunny environments. Due to its compact size and ornamental appeal, it is occasionally cultivated in rock gardens or as a container plant.
